sentence.Network_en: Her ear, shoulder and hip are in a straight line.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的耳朵、肩膀和髋部呈一条直线。

sentence.Network_en: Simon finished dialing and clamped the phone to his ear.
sentence.Network_cn: 西蒙拨完号，把听筒贴在耳边。

sentence.Network_en: She sat on Rossi's knee as he whispered in her ear.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐在罗西的膝盖上，听他低声耳语。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)全神贯注地听，洗耳恭听

jx.jx_en_mean: bring something, especially misfortune, on oneself
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使某事（尤指不幸）发生在自己身上

lj.lj_ly: she brought her world crashing about her ears.
lj.lj_ls: 她彻底毁了自己的生活。

jx.jx_en_mean: one is subconsciously aware of being talked about or criticized
jx.jx_cn_mean: （因被人谈论或批评而）耳朵在发热

phrase.cizu_name: grin (或 smile) from ear to ear
have something coming out of one's ears

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)have a substantial or excessive amount of something

lj.lj_ly: that man's got money coming out of his ears.

jx.jx_en_mean: have access to and influence with someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在某人那儿能说上话，能接近并影响某人

lj.lj_ly: he claimed to have the prime minister's ear.
lj.lj_ls: 他声称总理也听取他的意见。

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 keep) an ear to the ground

jx.jx_en_mean: be well informed about events and trends
jx.jx_cn_mean: 十分了解事态的进展，保持敏锐

phrase.cizu_name: in (at) one ear and out (at) the other

jx.jx_en_mean: heard but disregarded or quickly forgotten

lj.lj_ly: whatever he tells me seems to go in one ear and out the other.
lj.lj_ls: 无论他给我讲什么，我都是左耳进右耳出。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 心不在焉地听，似听非听
(非正式)不光彩地被打发走（或被解雇）

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)very busy with or deeply involved in

lj.lj_ly: I'm up to my ears in work here.
If you want to tell your story, we're all ears.
lj.lj_ls: 你想讲故事的话，我们会全神贯注地听的

jx.jx_en_mean: To pay close attention; listen attentively.

phrase.cizu_name: give an ear 或 lend an ear

jx.jx_en_mean: To be on the watch for new trends or information.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 敏锐，精明：注意新动向或信息

phrase.cizu_name: have an ear to the ground 或 keep an ear to the ground

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ēare, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch oor and German Ohr, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin auris and Greek ous
Old English ēar, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch aar and German Ähre

entry.def: Your ears are the two parts of your body, one on each side of your head, with which you hear sounds.

example.ex: He whispered something in her ear...
example.tran: 他在她耳边低声说了些什么。

entry.def: If you have an ear for music or language, you are able to hear its sounds accurately and to interpret them or reproduce them well.

example.ex: Moby certainly has a fine ear for a tune...
example.tran: 莫比无疑具有很好的乐感。

example.ex: An ear for foreign languages is advantageous.
example.tran: 能够听懂外语是种优势。

entry.def: Ear is often used to refer to people's willingness to listen to what someone is saying.

example.ex: What would cause the masses to give him a far more sympathetic ear?...
example.tran: 怎样才能使民众以更加体谅的心态倾听他的话呢？

example.ex: They had shut their eyes and ears to everything.
example.tran: 他们对一切都视而不见，充耳不闻。

entry.def: The ears of a cereal plant such as wheat or barley are the parts at the top of the stem, which contain the seeds or grains.

entry.tran: . 洗耳恭听;全神贯注地听
entry.def: If someone says that they are all ears, they mean that they are ready and eager to listen

entry.tran: （尤指让人恼火地）缠住…喋喋不休
entry.def: If you say that someone is bending  your ear about something, you mean that they keep talking to you about it because they think it is important; used especially when you are irritated by this.

example.ex: He was fed up with people bending his ear about staying on at school.
example.tran: 人们一个劲儿地跟他说要继续留在学校念书，这让他烦透了。

entry.def: If someone boxes a child's ears, they hit them on the side of their head as a punishment.

entry.tran: (要求)未被理睬，不被听取/(某人对要求)不予理睬，充耳不闻
entry.def: If a request falls on deaf ears or if the person to whom the request is made turns a deaf ear to it, they take no notice of it.

example.ex: I hope that our appeals will not fall on deaf ears...
example.tran: 我希望我们的呼吁不会没人理睬。

example.ex: He has turned a resolutely deaf ear to American demands for action.
example.tran: 他对美国提出的行动要求完全不理不睬。

entry.def: If you keep or have your ear to the ground, you make sure that you find out about the things that people are doing or saying.

example.ex: Jobs in manufacturing are relatively scarce but I keep my ear to the ground.
example.tran: 制造业的就业机会相对很少，但是我时刻留意着信息。

entry.def: If you listen to something or someone with only half an ear, you do not give your full attention to what is being said.
If you lend an ear to someone or their problems, you listen to them carefully and sympathetically.

example.ex: They are always willing to lend an ear and offer what advice they can.
example.tran: 他们总是愿意认真倾听并尽量提出建议。

entry.tran: 左耳进，右耳出;听过即忘
entry.def: If you say that something goes in one ear and out the other, you mean that someone pays no attention to it, or forgets about it immediately.

example.ex: That rubbish goes in one ear and out the other.
example.tran: 那种废话都是左耳进，右耳出。

entry.tran: 突然被解雇;突然被赶走
entry.def: If someone says that you will be out on your ear, they mean that you will be forced to leave a job, an organization or a place suddenly.

example.ex: We never objected. We'd have been out on our ears looking for another job if we had.
example.tran: 我们从未反对过，如果我们真的反对，早就被扫地出门，另谋高就了。

entry.tran: （不看乐谱而）凭记忆演奏(乐曲)
entry.def: If you play by ear or play a piece of music by ear, you play music by relying on your memory rather than by reading printed music.

example.ex: Neil played, by ear, the music he'd heard his older sister practicing.
example.tran: 尼尔凭着记忆弹奏他曾听到姐姐练习时弹的曲子。

entry.def: If you play it by ear, you decide what to say or do in a situation by responding to events rather than by following a plan which you have decided on in advance.

entry.tran: 深陷于;深深卷入；埋头于
entry.def: If you are up to your ears in something, it is taking up all of your time, attention, or resources.

example.ex: 'Why don't you come with me?' — 'I can't. I'm up to my ears in reports.'...
example.tran: “怎么不跟我一起来呀？”——“不行，我忙着写报告呢。”

example.ex: He was desperate. He was in debt up to his ears.

means.word_mean: 1. the sense organ for hearing and equilibrium
3. the externally visible cartilaginous structure of the external ear
5. fruiting spike of a cereal plant especially corn

example.en: You sometimes have a tin-ear for diatogue.
example.zh: 在跟人交谈时，你有时候听觉不大灵。

list.explanation: 耳朵缺乏音乐感，缺乏乐感的人

example.en: Tin-ear is a man who doesn' t like swing.
example.zh: 缺乏乐感的人是不喜欢强打节奏爵士乐的。
别再唠叨个不停烦人了!

sentences.en: His right ear was taken off.
The blind touched the elephant's ear and said that it was just like a huge fan.
sentences.cn: 这位盲人触摸到大象的一只耳朵, 然后说这头大象像一把大扇子。

sentences.en: She has some ears of rice in her hand.
The corn should be earing up.

jushi.english: The band doesn't sound out of tune to me, but then I've no ear for music.
jushi.chinese: 对我来说,乐队没有走调,不过我没有欣赏音乐的才能。

jushi.english: Everybody says there is more in his statement than meets the ear.
I heard him say so with my own ears.
